text:
Yet another unicode gripe
```julia> subscript(n) = join(Char(0x2080 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> superscript(n) = join(Char(0x2070 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> subscript(1234567890)
"₁₂₃₄₅₆₇₈₉₀"

julia> superscript(1234567890)
"ⁱ\u2072\u2073⁴⁵⁶⁷⁸⁹⁰"```

elements.text:
julia> subscript(n) = join(Char(0x2080 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> superscript(n) = join(Char(0x2070 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> subscript(1234567890)
"₁₂₃₄₅₆₇₈₉₀"

julia> superscript(1234567890)
"ⁱ\u2072\u2073⁴⁵⁶⁷⁸⁹⁰"

text:
For now I'm using this beautiful snippet lol
```superscript(n) = join(parse(Int, d) == 1 ? Char(0x00b9) : parse(Int, d) == 2 ? Char(0x00b2) : parse(Int, d) == 3 ? Char(0x00b3) : Char(0x2070 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> superscript(1234567890)
"¹²³⁴⁵⁶⁷⁸⁹⁰"```

elements.text: For now I'm using this beautiful snippet lol

superscript(n) = join(parse(Int, d) == 1 ? Char(0x00b9) : parse(Int, d) == 2 ? Char(0x00b2) : parse(Int, d) == 3 ? Char(0x00b3) : Char(0x2070 + parse(Int, d)) for d in string(n))

julia> superscript(1234567890)
"¹²³⁴⁵⁶⁷⁸⁹⁰"

text: Don't forget to star the subsuper proposal if you haven't already: <https://github.com/stevengj/subsuper-proposal>
